types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^53 - 1) and 2^53 - 1 since represented in JSON as double-precision floating point numbers specifiedby [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: complete

fields.name: percent_complete
fields.description: An int between 0-100 indicating an approximate completion percentage of this stream

fields.name: has_guidelines_set
fields.description: Whether this search has guidelines that will be sent

fields.name: guidelines
fields.description: Guideline information related to this stream

fields.name: error_keys
fields.description: Error keys raised during search stream execution

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: TravelerProfile
types.description:
A TravelerProfile is information that a user can specify for usage when booking things. It can represent information
about the user themselves or about other people. It can also be shared with other users.

fields.name: profile_name
fields.description: A display name for referring to this profile. E.g. Business International

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: The first name of the traveler specified on their travel ID.

fields.name: middle_name
fields.description: The middle name of the traveler specified on their travel ID.

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: The last name of the traveler specified on their travel ID.

fields.name: generational_suffix
fields.description: The generational suffix of a user. Ex: Jr./Sr./IV/III, etc

fields.name: gender
fields.description: The gender of the traveler specified on their travel ID.

fields.name: birthdate
fields.description: The birthdate of the traveler specified on their travel ID.

fields.name: birthyear
fields.description: The birth year of the traveler specified on their travel ID.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: An alternative phone number for this profile.

fields.name: confirmation_email
fields.description: An alternative email to send booking confirmations to.

fields.name: share_with_groups
fields.description: Whether this profile should be auto shared to groups

fields.name: is_group_profile
fields.description: Whether this profile should be auto shared to groups

fields.name: is_owning_user
fields.description: Designates this profile as representing the user who owns it. This does not tell us whether or not the user who owns it "is you". Please use "this_traveler_is_you" for that

fields.name: passport_country
fields.description: The country which issued the passport.

fields.name: passport_expiration
fields.description: The date of expiration for the passport.

fields.name: passport_number
fields.description: A passport number with no leading or trailing whitespace.
fields.deprecationReason: Removed PII, only last4 is stored now

fields.name: passport_number_last4
fields.description: Last 4 of passport number with no leading or trailing whitespace.

fields.name: redress_number
fields.description:
A number issued to the traveler by the US TSA's Secure Flight program to match the traveler with
                       their watch list redress case.
fields.deprecationReason: Removed PII, only last4 is stored now

fields.name: redress_number_last4
fields.description:
Last 4 of a number issued to the traveler by the US TSA's Secure Flight program to 
                       match the traveler with their watch list redress case.

fields.name: known_traveler_number
fields.description:
A KTN is a nine digit number issued to the traveler by the Global Entry, NEXUS, SENTRI, or TSA
                       Pre programs run by the US Government. This is required to get a boarding pass which lets the
                       traveler use the TSA Precheck security lines.
fields.deprecationReason: Removed PII, only last4 is stored now

fields.name: known_traveler_number_last4
fields.description:
Last 4 of of a KTN, which is a nine digit number issued to the traveler by the Global Entry, 
                       NEXUS, SENTRI, or TSA Pre programs run by the US Government. This is required to get a 
                       boarding pass which lets the traveler use the TSA Precheck security lines.

fields.name: known_traveler_number_first_digit
fields.description:
First digit of a KTN, which is a nine digit number issued to the traveler by the Global Entry, 
                       NEXUS, SENTRI, or TSA Pre programs run by the US Government. This is required to get a 
                       boarding pass which lets the traveler use the TSA Precheck security lines.

fields.description: Whether or not this booking can have its expense sent

inputFields.description: The unique identifier received with the previous poll result. This is used to paginate results. This is an optional parameter. When not specified, the chunk_id will be automatically tracked on the backend for a given stream_id. A stream's results can be "reset" by passing a chunk_id of `0`.

inputFields.name: class_info
inputFields.description: Selected class information is used to choose a pricing class level from the options returned under `FareOption.branded_pricing`. Specifying a selected class will update `LegOption.pricing` fields of subsequent responses to the selected class, and clear the `fare_options` lists of lower-ranked `BrandedPricing` nodes  in the `FareOption.branded_pricing` list. If not specified, the selected `cabin_type` will default to the type specified in the initial search, and `class_id` will default to the cheapest in that `cabin_type`

fields.name: confirmation_number
fields.description: Car agency confirmation code. This is the one that the traveler cares about.

fields.name: provider_confirmation_number
fields.description: Provider confirmation code. This is the one that the agents use to service the booking.

fields.name: price_changed_on_book
fields.description: Whether the booked price was different than what was expected. The difference should always be in favor of the customer. A price may drop when booking with a personal loyalty program.

fields.name: original_total_price
fields.description: The original expected total price. Only returned when `price_changed_on_book` is true

fields.name: within_guidelines
fields.description: Whether or not the booking is within guidelines

fields.name: reason_for_booking_out_of_guidelines_code
fields.description: Reason code for booking out of guidelines

fields.name: reason_for_booking_out_of_guidelines
fields.description: User entered reason for why they booked out of guidelines

fields.name: spending_cap
fields.description: The car booking spending capacity of the group

fields.name: provider
fields.description: The provider used for making this booking. Generally sabre or amadeus. We should change this to an enum at some point.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Whether or not this is an internal (our systems) or external booking. We should change this to an enum at some point.

fields.name: expense_tag
fields.description: How a customer has catgorized/tagged this booking expense.
fields.deprecationReason: Please use `expense_tags` to get all of the tags associated with the booking.

fields.name: expense_tags
fields.description: How a customer has catgorized/tagged this booking expense.

fields.name: booking_followers
fields.description: The emails that are following this booking.

fields.name: booking_status
fields.description: The overall status of this booking, from a *user's* point of view.

fields.name: booking_error_key
fields.description: A code representing the nature of why this booking errored (if it did). Note that more information about the error is available internally, but this provides a simple interface so clients can customize their messaging.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The internal status of the booking, derived from its events.
fields.deprecationReason: Please use `booking_status` for conveying statuses to users.

fields.name: consumable
fields.description: Whether this booking has been processed and is ready to be displayed to a user.

fields.name: fraud_score
fields.description: Indicates how likely it is that the booking is fradulent. Negative is good, positive is bad. From roughly -10 to 10.

fields.name: applied_user_loyalty_programs
fields.description: The loyalty programs that were successfully applied to this booking.

fields.name: group
fields.description: The group this booking was made under.

fields.name: group_department
fields.description: The group department under which this booking should be counted for reporting.

fields.name: payment_info
fields.description: Information about what payment method was used to place this booking.

fields.name: travelers
fields.description: The travelers for this booking

fields.name: expensing_email
fields.description: The email which will be used for expense reporting.

fields.name: expensable
fields.description: Whether or not this booking can be expensed

fields.name: expense_sendable
fields.description: Whether or not this booking can have its expense sent

fields.name: expense_sent
fields.description: Whether the expense has already been sent or not.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user who made/requested this booking.

fields.name: trips
fields.description: The trips this booking is part of.

fields.name: is_booked_by_you
fields.description: A flag denoting whether or not this booking was made by you.

fields.name: price_details
fields.description: What the user paid for something.

fields.name: is_external
fields.description: whether or not the booking is external or booked through Lola

fields.name: reported_booking_time
fields.description: When this booking was reported as being made, either by the provider or the importing user.

A KTN is a nine digit number issued to the traveler by the Global Entry, NEXUS, SENTRI, or TSA

                       traveler use the TSA Precheck security lines.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

fields.name: onOperation
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

fields.name: onFragment
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

fields.name: onField
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
